channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for IL

item.title: Report X-2024070914
item.description:
Report X-2024070914

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-15T18:15:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-10
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN AIR PACKAGE WAS BEING REWRAPPED DUE TO PACKAGE DETERIORATION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 25 POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING MEAT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ILLINOIS USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER B35222, THE PERSONAL BUTCHER, 225 MINEOLA BLVD APT 5I, MINEOLA NY 11501-2545.

item.title: Report X-2024070309
item.description:
Report X-2024070309

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-02
  • City: SOUTH ELGIN
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 6
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF states city driver Rafael Zawadzki (00933020) called safety at 08:15PM (CDT) about a hazmat spill that was not reported earlier in the day or cleaned by CURA. ABF driver stated that a bottle of UN2789, ACETIC ACID GLACIAL, 8 (3) PG II had spilled on the floor of trailer 401322 this morning. ABF driver stated that he began to feel lightheaded, nausea, shortness of breath, and headaches throughout the day he was delivering with the trailer. ABF driver states once he arrived back to ABF113, he notified Safety about the spill and his symptoms got worse. ABF driver reported his symptoms to Rodney Cooper (Operation Supervisor) and Rodney also stated he felt those same symptoms. ABF states during the call with Mr. Cooper, he informed Safety that his 4 other workers at that time (Rafael Zawadzki, Jason Granderson, James Fortin, and Joe Keefer) had also experienced these same symptoms. ABF Safety advised that at all costs, stay away from trailer 401322 until CURA had serviced it. ABF Safety immediately notified hazmat on-call at 08:43PM about the situation and on-call stated to do a spill report like normal and call CURA out to the scene ASAP. ABF Safety called CURA at 08:57PM and CURA dispatched a team to the location arriving at 10:26PM. ABF SCM Joshua Sabolcik states that they took one employee to Ascension Saint Joseph - Elgin Hospital (847-695-3200) and his 4 other workers to Advocate Sherman Hospital (847-742-9800) in Elgin, IL for treatment.

item.title: Report E-2024070199
item.description:
Report E-2024070199

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-12T15:12:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-25
  • City: ARCOLA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) quart of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and placed the recovered material and damaged pail into one (1) 6-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070183
item.description:
Report E-2024070183

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-08
  • City: EAST PEORIA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to improper loading. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area with absorbents and placed the damaged pail and cleanup debris into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024070119
item.description:
Report E-2024070119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-06
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On July 6, 2024, at 0455 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of Methyl Ethyl Ketone. ERTS was informed terminal personnel discovered a release of a 1 cup of Methyl Ethyl Ketone (UN1193, 3, II) from (1) 5-gallon DM that impacted a concrete dock. Terminal personnel were able to clean the release with absorbents and place the damaged pail and spent absorbents in a 5-gallon DM for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024070451
item.description:
Report X-2024070451

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-10T18:16:19+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-04
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package was immediately called out as a Damaged HazMat by RORS Unload Manager Grant. Package was immediately taken to the Hazmat cage for isolation and processing. Neutralizer was also put down on a small spill of Sulfuric Acid on the floor near bank 3, door 1 for safety reasons. Items had absolutely no seals underneath their caps. Please use seals to prevent leaks on bottles, especially when transporting dangerous and hazardous material.
